case_vignette: A 34-year-old healthy female presents for evaluation of a bump on her left third finger present over the past nine months! She denies any trauma to the area and first noticed it when getting a manicure! The spot began as a small bump that progressively enlargened with associated depression of the fingernail! Physical examination of the left third finger reveals a translucent nodule along the proximal nail fold with associated longitudinal depression of the nail plate!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a bump on my left third finger and my fingernail has a sort of dent running along it.
Has the bump changed in size or appearance recently?
Yes, the bump started small and has progressively gotten larger.
Do you have any pain or redness around the bump?
No, I don't have any pain or redness around the bump.
Do you have any similar bumps on other fingers or any other part of your body?
No, I don't have similar bumps on any other fingers or parts of my body.
Do you have a history of trauma or injury to that finger?
No, I haven't had any trauma or injury to that finger.
Do you have a personal or family history of skin cancer or unusual skin growths?
I don't have any personal or family history of skin cancer or unusual skin growths.
Are you currently taking any medications or have any other medical conditions?
No, I am not taking any medications and I don't have any other medical conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Myxoid cyst
